intro: Seselinia, commonly known as common sesel, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound umbels of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are usually pinnately divided, giving the plant a delicate, feathery appearance. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and often grows in meadows and along roadsides. Seselinia is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
